definition[0]: if part of something falls off, it becomes separated from the main part
example[0]: The door handle keeps falling off.
example[1]: A button had fallen off her jacket.
definition[1]: if the amount, rate, or quality of something falls off, it decreases
example[2]: Audience figures fell off during the second series of the programme.
definition[2]: used to say that someone was very surprised when something happened
example[3]: When I saw my brother on the stage I nearly fell off my chair.
definition[3]: a decrease in the level, amount, or number of something
example[5]: The charity reported that gifts have fallen off by more than 60% in value.
